word: Although I had prayed for months that the Lord would make my path so plain that I might know that I was making no mistake, still I was obliged to say that \93God hangs a mist o'er my eyes.\94 But when I had taken my seat in the cars, the assurance came that I was moving in accordance with the will of God. Many friends had come to the station to see us off. It was a place of great confusion, and I had not been able to bear anything of the kind for months. But it did not trouble me now. The sweet peace that God alone can give was imparted to me, and, like a wearied child, I found rest in Jesus.
